{{Infobox software | name = ImgBurn | logo = [[File:ImgBurn logo.png|50px|ImgBurn Logo]] | screenshot = [[File:ImgBurn screenshot.png|250px]] | developer = Lightning UK! | caption = ImgBurn screenshot | latest_release_version = 2.5.6.0 | latest_release_date = {{Start date and age|2011|10|04|df=yes}}{{cite web|url=http://www.imgburn.com/index.php?act=changelog|title=ImgBurn Change log}} | operating_system = [[Microsoft Windows]]
[[Wine (software)|Wine]] officially supportedhttp://wiki.winehq.org/AppsThatSupportWine | genre = [[CD/DVD authoring]] | language = Multilingual | license = [[Freeware]] | website = [http://www.imgburn.com www.imgburn.com] }} '''ImgBurn''' is a [[freeware]] program that allows the [[CD recorder|recording]] of many types of [[CD]]/[[DVD]] images to recordable media ([[Cue_sheet (computing)|.cue]] files are supported as of version 2.4.0.0).[http://www.imgburn.com/ The Official ImgBurn Website] Starting with version 2.0.0.0, ImgBurn can also burn files and data directly to CD/DVD. It supports padding DVD-Video files so the layer break occurs on a proper cell boundary (where possible). As of version 2.5.1.0, ImgBurn includes optional [[adware]] in the installer.http://www.ghacks.net/2010/03/17/dvd-burning-software-imgburn-updated-turns-adware/ ==History== ImgBurn is an [[optical disc authoring]] software created by Lightning UK, the author of [[DVD Decrypter]], after he was forced to stop development of DVD Decrypter in response to a [[cease and desist]] order from [[Macrovision]].{{cite web |last=Mennecke |first=Thomas |title=Macrovision Forces Removal of DVD Decrypter |publisher=Slyck |date=2005-11-24 |url=http://www.slyck.com/story1007.html |accessdate=2007-05-18}} ImgBurn is based on the optical disc burning engine of DVD Decrypter; however, it does not have the ability to circumvent copy protections of encrypted DVDs. As of version 2.3.0.0, ImgBurn can create image files from unencrypted CDs/DVDs. It cannot, however, remove [[Content Scramble System|CSS encryption]] or any other [[copy protection]]. It is possible to use third-party software such as [[DVD43]], an intermediate driver that operates between the hardware and software, for such purpose. == Features == *Supported formats: BIN, CUE, DI, DVD, GI, IMG, ISO, MDS, NRG, PDI and more. *Ability to build DVD Video discs (from a VIDEO_TS folder), HD DVD Video discs (from a HVDVD_TS folder) and Blu-ray Video discs (from a BDAV / BDMV folder). *Full [[unicode]] folder/file name support. *Supported environments: Windows 95, 98, Me, NT4, 2000, XP, 2003, Vista, 2008, 7 and 2008 R2 (including all the 64-bit versions). It also officially supports [[Wine (software)|Wine]]. *[http://www.imgburn.com/index.php?act=screenshots#isowrite_queue Image queue] provides support for burning several images with minimum interaction. *ImgBurn is relatively lightweight (compared to [[List of optical disc authoring software|similar]] programs); under 1.8MB for all installed features. == Limitations == *Does not support RAW disk ripping or burning{{cite web | url = http://forum.imgburn.com/index.php?showtopic=3343&st=60&p=39221&#entry39221 | title = ImgBurn v2.2.0.0 Released! | accessdate =2009-08-01 | date = 2007-02-19 | name = LIGHTNING UK}} *Does not support multi-session discs{{cite web | url = http://forum.imgburn.com/index.php?showtopic=3433&view=findpost&p=39535| title = Multisession Disk Where is the option?? | accessdate =2010-04-24 | date = 2007-02-22 | name = LIGHTNING UK}} *Cannot read or write CD [[Compact disc subcode|subchannel data]] *Cannot copy discs directly, without first creating an image file. {{cite web | url = http://forum.imgburn.com/index.php?showtopic=6380 | title = How to copy a disc using Imgburn | accessdate = 2011-02-12 | date = 2008-03-20 | name = LIGHTNING UK!}} == Hardware interface support == ImgBurn supports numerous low level drive access interfaces. This allows it to operate on almost all Windows platforms. ImgBurn can use any of the following interfaces: *[[Advanced SCSI programming interface|ASPI]] - WNASPI32.DLL ([[Adaptec]]) *ASAPI - ASAPI.DLL (VOB Computersysteme/[[Pinnacle Systems]]) *[[SCSI Pass Through Interface]] - [[Microsoft]] *ElbyCDIO - Elaborate Bytes * Patin-Couffin - VSO Software ==See also== *[[List of ISO image software]] *[[List of optical disc authoring software]] *[[Digital Millennium Copyright Act]] *[[AnyDVD]] ==References== {{Reflist|1}} ==External links== *[http://www.imgburn.com/ ImgBurn website] *[http://filehippo.com/download_imgburn/ Archive of downloads for all versions of ImgBurn] *[http://www.afterdawn.com/software/cdr_software/cdr_tools/imgburn.cfm Another archive of ImgBurn all versions] {{Optical disc image software}} [[Category:Optical disc authoring software]] [[Category:Windows-only freeware]] [[Category:Portable software]] [[es:ImgBurn]] [[ja:ImgBurn]] [[pt:ImgBurn]] [[ru:ImgBurn]] [[sv:ImgBurn]] [[uk:ImgBurn]] [[zh:ImgBurn]]
